section.name: Number Guessing Game Example
section.p: This example shows a number guessing game implemented with Struts Flow. The goal is to show the basic concepts of continuations, so the example is kept simple. There are basically three parts to the example: the flow code, the Struts config, and the JSP's that display the output.

section.name: Flow Code
section.p: Here is what the flow code looks like:
Notice how the program loops until the number is guessed, even though pages are being sent to the browser to gather user input.

section.name: Struts Configuration
section.p: To configure this application with Struts, the following action mapping and plug-in are defined in struts-config.xml:
section.pre:
<action-mappings>
<action path="/guess" type="net.sf.struts.flow.FlowAction" className="net.sf.struts.flow.FlowMapping">
<set-property property="function" value="main"/> <forward name="failure" path="/guess.jsp"/> <forward name="success" path="/success.jsp"/> </action> </action-mappings>
<plug-in className="net.sf.struts.flow.FlowPlugIn"> <set-property property="scripts" value="/WEB-INF/numberguess.js" /> </plug-in>
section.p: The function property of the custom action mapping tells FlowAction which JavaScript function to call.

section.name: JSP Presentation
section.p: To gather the user's guess, guess.jsp generates a form:
section.pre:
Guess the Number Between 1 and 10

<%= request.getAttribute("hint") %>

You've guessed <%= request.getAttribute("guesses") %> times.
section.p: The hidden input variable contid stores the continuation to load from when the form gets submitted.
